alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Montgomery; Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 3:57PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Pike, southwestern Bullock and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 357 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Grady to near Troy Municipal Airport. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Troy, Meadville, Pine Level, Kent, Dublin, Beans Crossroads, Linwood, Shopton, Ansley, Grady, Troy Municipal Airport, Ramer, Troy University, High Ridge, Orion, China Grove, Sandfield and Currys. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
